repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Currently, there's no way to tell neovim not to show progress messages in message area. This would be useful because third-party plugins can listen to the Progress event and show the progress status in their own way. But currently, it'd lead to the progress message being shown twice. Once by the building message system and once by the plugin.

Solution:
Add progress: entry in existing 'messageopts' option to control this behavior

Adds progress:c to messageopts as default. Here c stands for cmd. Later we can add things like s for statusline and etc as we introduce them. Using one char basically allows for easy mixing and matching of different combinations of possible values.

closes #35535

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3693,4 +3693,61 @@ describe('progress-message', function()
       data = {},
     }, 'progress autocmd receives progress messages')
   end)
+
+  it('can be hidden from cmdline with messagesopt-=progress:c', function()
+    exec('set messagesopt-=progress:c')
+    api.nvim_echo(
+      { { 'test-message: not shown in cmdline' } },
+      true,
+      { kind = 'progress', title = 'TestSuit', percent = 10, status = 'running' }
+    )
+    screen:expect([[
+      ^                         |
+      {1:~                        }|*4
+    ]])
+
+    assert_progress_autocmd({
+      text = { 'test-message: not shown in cmdline' },
+      percent = 10,
+      status = 'running',
+      title = 'TestSuit',

comment_data.body: This seems confusing as long as empty and `c` are the only options.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4374,6 +4418,12 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 			|:messages| history.  The maximum value is 10000.
 			Setting it to zero clears the message history.
 			This item must always be present.
+	progress:{s}
+			Determines where to show progress messages.
+			the value string can be empty or can contain
+			any combination of values below. empty means progress

@@ -4374,6 +4418,12 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 			|:messages| history.  The maximum value is 10000.
 			Setting it to zero clears the message history.
 			This item must always be present.
+	progress:{s}
+			Determines where to show progress messages.
+			the value string can be empty or can contain
+			any combination of values below. empty means progress

comment_regular_data.body:
This just affects the "legacy" messages codepath, right? What happens with the new `extui` enabled?

(The legacy messages are planned for aggressive deprecation in favor of the new `extui` messages and progress, so I don't think adding a bandaid -- that diverges from Vim -- now is a good idea.)

> This just affects the "legacy" messages codepath, right? What happens with the new `extui` enabled?
> 
> (The legacy messages are planned for aggressive deprecation in favor of the new `extui` messages and progress, so I don't think adding a bandaid -- that diverges from Vim -- now is a good idea.)

This stops progress messages on both legacy messages and extui, when cmd is not set. At that point for now, only Progress events remain. Which plugins or any other ui can listen to and shown them as they like. 

Also, if I'm not mistaken, basically everything that is shown in cmd goes to extui once an extui is connected. if the extui registeres a specific ext_message handler, the cmd messages goes as seperate event to ui. if not then it get's shown in the ui-grid where cmdline is supposed to be. In that case messages don't have specific distinctions for extui vs cmd internally just how they get rendered in the end.

But we _do_ want to make distinctions in the (extui) message protocol, which plugins should be able to (selectively) subscribe to. A lot of work has already been done in that direction, and my concern is that this change does not fit into it but instead creates a separate (possibly conflicting, and certainly affecting upstream patches) solution. So before continuing here, I would like @luukvbaal to comment on this.

> But we _do_ want to make distinctions in the (extui) message protocol, which plugins should be able to (selectively) subscribe to.

The suggested approach is outlined [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35535#issuecomment-3476672519):

> Note: this can just be `set messagesopt+=progress:none/cmd` initially to unblock it from the ui2 work, as this is also necessary when ui2 is not enabled. In the future it might be expanded with new flag values to cover ui2, like `msg` (for a dedicated message window).

It looks fairly forward compatible. In case there will be an option to disable ui2 in favor of legacy messages, it is also needed for progress notifications plugins to also work without duplicating messages.

>  In case there will be an option to disable ui2 in favor of legacy messages

Not long-term, since the whole legacy grid code is planned for removal (that is the "aggressive" part in my comment), timeline TBD. But if the ui2 configuration is (still) planned to be controlled by `msgopt`, then this is indeed not in conflict. Again, I just want to make sure that @luukvbaal gives the go-ahead before time and effort is possibly wasted. (From painful experience, Vim option changes are in constant danger of incompatible upstream additions...)

> In case @clason was concerned about my comment regarding lumping all message kinds into a single option

No, I was only concerned about whether this PR fits into the general short- and long-term strategy for the new message ui2. If you say it does, that's good enough for me.

Table options have receded into the far future, so these can't block other features.

@luukvbaal are there any other blockers for progress messages on ui2 ?

Note: When cmd is removed from messagesopt progress messages are no longer sent as msg_show event to extui either. extui2 can still capture them from the Progress autocmd event, right? Also, the event has the raw progress item instead of a formatted string. So it's a better source anyway.

> extui2 can still capture them from the Progress autocmd event, right?

Sure, though I don't foresee supporting progress messages in a way not covered by `cmd/msg`, which both would go through the UI event. I don't think UI2 would ever itself _set_ `progress:` to then use the autocmd event, that seems quite backwards, but is fine for non UI-event plugins I guess. No blockers.

> I don't think UI2 would ever itself set progress: to then use the autocmd event, that seems quite backwards

Nah not like that. Say once ui2 aupports progress we can add another flag to `progress:` for it. For example, a floating progress bar in ui2. Users can use that flag to enable that ui2 feature.

Either way, for now current setup is fine. This can be iterated on once other stuff supports progress
Can someone put a 0.12 label or get it merged so it doesn't get missed in 0.12 :] ?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: Nvim 0.12 mesages/dialog/pager/notifications based on the UI-ext protocol
labels.name: ui2

title: feat(progress): Add option to hide progress messages from cmdline
